turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Worf to Bridge.

turns.speaker: RIKER'S COM VOICE
turns.text: Riker here.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: There's a dampening field in place on this deck. Our tricorders are useless.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Worf to Bridge. We're about to enter the Environmental Control Room.

turns.speaker: RIKER'S COM VOICE
turns.text: Any sign of Data, or the Borg themselves?

turns.speaker: RIKER'S COM VOICE
turns.text: Worf? Is something wrong?

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Something is very wrong, Commander. We're falling back.

turns.speaker: RIKER'S COM VOICE
turns.text: What the hell happened down there, Worf?

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Commander... we have a problem.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: No response.  I'm not reading any Starfleet com traffic in this entire sector.

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Captain, I've scanned the planet. The atmosphere contains a high concentration of methane, carbon monoxide and fluorine. The oceans have been chemically altered, as well.

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Captain, they're firing at a nuclear missile silo... in central Montana.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Target...

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Are we in any danger of being detected by Earth defense systems?

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: There were no planetary defense systems in this era. Their weapons were designed to fight each other... not extraterrestrials.

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Even Data?

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Data's positronic net contains classified information on the Enterprise. Command codes, security protocols...

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: They may be trying to send a message to the other Borg...the Borg in this time period...

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: What kind of message?

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL DONALD
turns.text: Mr. President.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Admiral Donald...Bill...

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL DONALD
turns.text: Mr. President we cannot allow Federation citizens to be abducted.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: At present I'm awaiting a full report from Enterprise. Pending that I am constrained to observe Interstellar Law.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: I'd prefer not to be the President to push the button if I can avoid it.

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL DONALD
turns.text: The longer we wait, the less accessible the hostages will be, Mr. President.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: I'll bear it in mind, Admiral. I think that's all.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Good luck, Captain.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: I'm going too. They may need a doctor.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: I believe the operation is over.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The charge is murder.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: I'm going to perform surgery on a torpedo - you never know...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: You may need assistance, doctor...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Fascinating...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Bet you wish you'd stood in bed...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Vulcans sleep lying down...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Spock, that was actually funny.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: We DO sleep lying down.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Calm yourself, doctor, the operation is almost complete...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Thank you, nurse. Jim, she's ready! Lock and load!

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Pity they're retiring us just as I was starting to understand you, Spock...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: We WERE beginning to hit our stride together, doctor...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Or not to be -

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: That's the question -

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Uh, Jim...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You heard the order, Lieutenant.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: What the Hell's going on?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I wish I knew. Uhura?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Sweet Jesus...! He's lost a lot of whatever this stuff is...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Can you - ?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Jim, I don't even know his anatomy.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Chancellor Gorkon, can you hear me? Chancellor...?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Thanks...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: What's the Brotherhood of Aliens?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Figures.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We've been set up all along.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Bones, why don't you see what you can do? Let them know we're not holding a grudge.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Suppose HE'S holding a grudge?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Three months till retirement. What a way to finish.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We're not finished.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Speak for yourself. One day... one night...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: - <U>Kobayashi Maru</U>...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Bones, are you afraid of the future?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: That was the general idea I intended to convey.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I didn't mean this future.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Are we playing multiple choice?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Some people ARE afraid of the future; of what MIGHT happen;  I was frightened, really frightened.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Specifically of...?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: No more neutral zone. I was USED to hating Klingons... that's why I failed in our assignment.  It never even occurred to me to take Gorkon at his word. Spock was right.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Well, don't be too hard on yourself - we all felt exactly the same -

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Uh uh. Somebody felt much worse. And I'm starting to understand why.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Well, if you've got any bright ideas, now's the time to -

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: What is it with you, anyway?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Still think we're finished?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: More than ever.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: What kind of creature is this? Last night you two were spooning -

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Don't remind me.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Jim, leave me - I'm finished...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: No way.  You see this?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: It's the viridium patch Spock slapped on my back right before we went aboard Gorkon's ship.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: That cunning little Vulcan...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Once we're beyond the shield they should be able to pick it up two sectors away.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: If they're even looking for us...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock's looking for us...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: ARE YOU CRAZY?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: She didn't need our help getting anywhere... where did she get these convenient clothes? And don't tell me that flare is standard prison issue...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Damned clever if you ask me...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Killed trying to escape - it's a classic...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: ABSOLUTELY NOT!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Come on...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Time we got underway ourselves, gentlemen.  Once again, we've saved civilization as we know it.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: And the good news is they're not going to prosecute.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: To be -

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Perhaps with a few small steps at a time. Like this one.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: And perhaps with a large step or two. Like a peace treaty.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: We're explorers not diplomats!

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Starfleet's killed an awful lot of natural phenomena in the name of "exploration"...

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Captain, when we get to Camp Khitomer, how will we defend ourselves? I mean, if this new Bird of Prey can fire while she is invisible...?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Now there's a poser.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: This is fun...

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Captain, shall we attempt to return fire?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Too bad we can't SMELL her.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: In space, no one can hear you sweat.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: They don't arrest people for having feelings.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: If they did we'd all have to turn ourselves in. How CAN we rely on them?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Are you carrying a surgeon?

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: We were until your torpedoes!

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Then let me help!

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: Doctor McCoy, what is your current medical status?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Aside from a touch of arthritis, I'd say pretty good.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: For 27 years I have been Ship's Surgeon and later Chief Medical Officer aboard the USS Enterprise. In three months I'm due to stand down.

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: Stand...?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Retire.

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: Ah. I believe you also consumed Romulan ale at the officers' mess on the night of question, Doctor?

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: Was Chancellor Gorkon alive when you first examined him?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Barely.

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: Have you saved patients as "barely" alive as he was?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: I didn't have the knowledge of Klingon anatomy I needed.

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: You say you are due for retirement. May I ask: do your hands shake?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: I was nervous -

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: You were incompetent! - whether deliberately or as a result of age combined with drink this court will determine.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: I tried to save him! I was desperate to save him! He was the last best hope in the universe for real peace.

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: The Chancellor herself will testify that the defendant's hands shook.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: I don't believe we can get more out of the way than this.

turns.speaker: MARTIA
turns.text: They'll make it look like an accident...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: What are you in for, if you don't mind me asking?

turns.speaker: MARTIA
turns.text: I don't mind. Smuggling. Guilty. I come from Arc. Smuggling is an ancient and respected trade there.

turns.speaker: MARTIA
turns.text: They'll respect him now...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: That's a comfort...

turns.speaker: MARTIA
turns.text: It takes a lot of effort.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: I don't wonder. Stop me if I'm wrong but do we really have any way of knowing if this is the real you?

turns.speaker: MARTIA
turns.text: I thought I would assume a pleasing shape.  We're outside the shield. Now it's your turn, Kirk.

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: I've always wanted to meet you, Captain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I'm not sure how to take that.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Would you care to go topside?

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: Very much.

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: "To be or not to be, that is the question" which preoccupies our people, Captain Kirk. We need BREATHING room...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I beg your pardon?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: My God, what happened here?

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: You feign ignorance?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: WHAT HAPPENED?

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: You crippled our gravitational field with a direst torpedo hit, and two Starfleet crewmen beamed aboard in magnetic boots and did this! WE HAVE WITNESSES!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: He's a DOCTOR!

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: How can I trust --

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: Under article 184 of Interstellar Law, I place you both under arrest. You are charged with assassinating the Chancellor of the High Council.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: He just tried to save him!

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: Take them away.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: Isn't it a fact that you served Romulan ale, a beverage illegal in the Federation because of its overwhelming potency?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: The drink WAS served...

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: And you still maintain your ship did not fire on Kronos One? Would you have known if she had? Come now, Captain. The record clearly there were no other ships in the sector.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: There... were no other ships in the sector.

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: Did you have occasion to refer to your ship's data banks during that night?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I checked the data banks, yes.

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: And what did they tell you?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: That we fired two photon torpedoes. But -

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: And now we come to the architect of this tragic affair, Captain James Tiberius Kirk. I put it to you, Captain, that you were seeking revenge for the death of your son.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: That isn't true...!

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: That, either as an instrument of Federation policy or acting on your own drunken initiative, you and your fellow conspirators crippled KRONOS One and cold-bloodedly assassinated the Chancellor of the High Council. Then you and Doctor McCoy went aboard to make certain the job was complete.

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: Are those your words?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: Spoken by you?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: Louder, please. We cannot hear you.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Those words WERE spoken by me.

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: You were demoted...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: For insubordination.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I have on occasion disobeyed orders.

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: And you were obeying or disobeying orders the night you arranged the assassination of Chancellor Gorkon?

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: You deny Enterprise fired on KRONOS One?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Well, I -

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: You deny that your men beamed aboard KRONOS One and shot the Chancellor?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I cannot confirm or deny actions which I did not witness.

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: Captain Kirk, are you aware that under Federation law, the Captain of a Starship is considered responsible for the actions of his men?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I am.

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: So if it should prove members of your crew did in fact carry out such an assassination - ?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: As Captain I am responsible for the conduct of the crew under my command.

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: Your honors, the State rests.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Where is Mr. Sulu?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Captain Sulu... on assignment... anyone seen Spock?

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Captain, you're not going to show them the bridge??

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Full diplomatic courtesy, Mr. Chekov...

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Just the size of my head -

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I know what you mean...

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Torpedo room--?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Uhura, monitor!

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Captain, if they fire at us with our shields down --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Torpedo bay! DID we fire those torpedoes?

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Get close enough to a man and you can kill him on "Stun" without setting off the alarm - of course you can't get rid of the body...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: First rule of assassination: always kill the assassins.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: From Starfleet?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Who else?

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Where IS the conference?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: She's only a cog in the wheel - no way she knows that.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: She's here - somewhere.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: But if she's cloaked...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Then all we've got is a neutron radiation surge - and by the time we're close enough to record it, we're ashes...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Shields. Battle stations.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Shields up. Battle stations.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Chekov, take us forward, thrusters only, one half impulse power...

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Aye, sir; thrusters...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Chekov, slow down. Take us forward, thrusters only, one quarter impulse power.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Aye, sir; thrusters...

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Course heading, Captain?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Second star to the right - and straight on till morning...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: They're preparing to fire.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Shields up, Captain --?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: You're forgetting something.  the data banks say WE fired. If we did, the killers are here; if we didn't, whoever altered the data banks is here. Either way, what we're searching for is here...

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: What ARE we searching for, Mr. Spock?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: You tell them, Lieutenant.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Klingon blood.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: They must have walked through it when it was floating and tracked it back here.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: This is the first evidence that corroborates our theory.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Now we go to Starfleet?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Now we expand our search to include uniforms.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: ALL uniforms?

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Mr. Spock, Rura Penthe's deep in Klingon territory. If we're discovered...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Quite right, Mr. Chekov. What is now required is a feat of linguistic legerdemain - and a degree of intrepidity. Before the Captain and Doctor McCoy freeze to death.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: You must have cursed yourself, for having programmed our data banks, Lieutenant. Only they revealed something wrong aboard Enterprise.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: She programmed the torpedo hits?

turns.speaker: COMMUNICATIONS OFFICER
turns.text: Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Mr. Valtane, any more data?

turns.speaker: COMMUNICATIONS OFFICER
turns.text: Captain, I'm getting a message from Klingon High Command.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Onscreen.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: An INCIDENT?

turns.speaker: COMMUNICATIONS OFFICER
turns.text: Do we report this, sir?

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Are you kidding?  Send to Starfleet Command...

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Send to commander Enterprise: "We stand ready to assist you. Captain Sulu, USS Excelsior." Attach our co-ordinates.

turns.speaker: COMMUNICATIONS OFFICER
turns.text: Is that wise, sir? I mean, given their situation -  Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: GORKON
turns.text: This is KRONOS One. I am Chancellor Gorkon.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Chancellor. We've been ordered to escort you through Federation space to your meeting place on Earth.

turns.speaker: GORKON
turns.text: Thank you, Captain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Uh, would you and your party care to dine this evening aboard Enterprise with my officers as guests of the United Federation of Planets?

turns.speaker: GORKON
turns.text: We'd be delighted to accept your gracious invitation.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We'll make arrangements to have you beamed aboard at 1930 hours.

turns.speaker: GORKON
turns.text: I shall look forward to it.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Chancellor, may I present Commander Spock, whom I believe you know, Dr. Leonard McCoy, chief medical officer, Montgomery Scott, chief engineer...

turns.speaker: GORKON
turns.text: Commander, face to face at last.. you have my thanks..

turns.speaker: GORKON
turns.text: Your research laboratory is most impressive...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Starfleet's been charting and cataloging planetary atmospheres. All vessels are equipped with chemical analytic sensors...

turns.speaker: GORKON
turns.text: This cannot be easy for you, Captain...  I would feel awkward if I had to give you a tour of OUR vessel...

turns.speaker: GORKON
turns.text: Thank you, Captain Kirk. The evening has been most... edifying.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We must do this again soon.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I've heard of chameloids - "Shapeshifters" - I thought you were mythical.

turns.speaker: MARTIA'S VOICE
turns.text: Give a girl a chance, Captain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: An accident wasn't good enough...

turns.speaker: MARTIA'S VOICE
turns.text: Good enough for one - two would look suspicious... killed while attempting escape... now that's convincing for both.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Your friends are late...

turns.speaker: MARTIA'S VOICE
turns.text: They'll be here...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Isn't it about time you became something else?

turns.speaker: MARTIA'S VOICE
turns.text: I like it here...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What took you so long?

turns.speaker: MARTIA'S VOICE
turns.text: Kill him! He's the one!!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Not me, idiot - HIM!

turns.speaker: MARTIA
turns.text: He wants your obedience to the Brotherhood of Aliens.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: He's got it.

turns.speaker: MARTIA
turns.text: And your coat.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Fraid not. It wouldn't fit him, anyway.

turns.speaker: MARTIA
turns.text: Krandog aranty.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: How did you know...?

turns.speaker: MARTIA
turns.text: There's a reward for your death.

turns.speaker: MARTIA
turns.text: We don't get many presidential assassins.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We didn't kill Gorkon.

turns.speaker: MARTIA
turns.text: Of course not. Anyway, somebody up there wants you out of the way.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: How much time's left of your sentence?

turns.speaker: MARTIA
turns.text: Don't you know? Everyone on Rura Penthe is here for life.
